title: Oil, Natural-Gas Prices Vault as Sanctions Threaten Russia’s Commodity Exports
sub_head: European energy ministers are due to discuss steps to maintain energy supplies while war wages on eastern flank
body:
Oil, natural-gas and grain prices jumped as a broadside of sanctions on Russia over the weekend threatened to ensnare commodities exports from the resource-rich nation.
Futures for Brent crude, the benchmark in international oil markets, rose 4.9% to $98.73 a barrel in London trading Monday. Earlier, Brent rose as high as $101.28 a barrel. Natural-gas prices leapt 15% in Europe, where countries’ dependence on Russian gas has been thrown into sharp relief. U.S. gas prices rose 3.4% to $4.64 per million British thermal units.
